thread.title: One year on from David Bowie's death, London prepares to remember the music legend
thread.title_full: One year on from David Bowie's death, London prepares to remember the music legend

author: Chloe Chaplain
title: One year on from David Bowie's death, London prepares to remember the music legend
text:
David Bowie receives a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, 1997 Getty Images 
David Bowie performing at Wembley Stadium in 1999 Getty Images 
David Bowie with Debbie Harry at the MEN Arena, 2003 Getty Images 
David Bowie with Kate Moss at an awards party at New York Public Library, 2005 Getty Images 
David Bowie at the CFDA Awards, 2005 Getty Images 
David Bowie with Lou Reed at the Lou Reed NY photography exhibit, 2006 Getty Images 
David Bowie and Iman at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, 2008 Getty Images 17/21 
Angie Bowie, Zowie Bowie (Duncan Jones) and David Bowie (wearing an eyepatch) appear at a press conference at the Amstel Hotel on 7th February 1974 in Amsterdam, Netherlands Gijsbert Hanekroot/Redferns 18/21 
Singer David Bowie with his wife, model and actress Angela Bowie on January 01, 1974 in London Anwar Hussein/Getty Images 
David Bowie in Labrynth 20/21 
Duncan Jones and David Bowie at the Tribeca Film Festival, New York, America on 30 April 2009 Rex 
David Bowie pictured to promote his Black Star album Tributes: fans flocked to the Bowie mural opposite Brixton station after his death 
Thousands of David Bowie fans across London will today remember the singer with a series of events marking the first anniversary of the music legend's death. 
The Brixton- born star continuously offered an alternative for music fans as he reinvented his look, from Ziggy Stardust to the Thin White Duke, up until his final record Blackstar - released just days before he died of cancer. 
After news of his death in January 2016, fans took to the streets in Brixton to celebrate his life and music. 
And a year later, a similar anniversary event is set to take place. Hundreds of people plan to attend an event set up via Facebook in tribute to the icon at the mural dedicated to him in Brixton, which was recently preserved under clear perspex sheets. 
The Ritzy cinema in Brixton plans to screen three Bowie short films from across three decades including silent mime-themed art film The Image. Celebrity deaths in 2016: from David Bowie to Debbie Reynolds 
Today's events celebrating the singer’s life and mourning his death come after thousands of fans attended a tribute concert on what would have been his 70th birthday on Sunday. David Bowie: The singer died after battling cancer in January 2016 (Leonhard Foeger/Reuters) 
The south London show was a “mammoth three-hour love-in” which included performances of Bowie’s most-loved hits. 
Hollywood actor Gary Oldman led former band-mates and friends of the Ziggy Stardust star on stage for a sell-out show at the Brixton Academy. Sound and vision: La Roux sings Golden Years at the tribute concert (WireImage) 
Simon Le Bon of Duran Duran, Spandau Ballet's Tony Hadley, Def Leppard's Joe Elliott and La Roux were among the singers to perform a string of hits at the concert. 
Bowie posthumously released a new EP over the weekend of his birthday. David Bowie tribute concert 
No Plan, which includes Blackstar's Lazarus as well as three songs written for the Lazarus musical, are believed to be his final recordings. 
On Sunday his widow Iman paid tribute to her husband of 24 years on social media, as she uploaded a drawing of a young Bowie wearing a Ziggy Stardust lightning bolt and wrote: "8th #ForeverLove #BowieForever." — Iman Abdulmajid (@The_Real_IMAN) January 8, 2017 Happy birthday (grand)dad. We love you. Goodnight. pic.twitter.com/O4St8GJu6G — Duncan Jones (@ManMadeMoon) January 8, 2017 
Bowie's son, director Duncan Jones, wrote: "Happy birthday (grand)dad. We love you. Goodnight", alongside pictures of his father. 
The anniversary of his death comes just days after it was revealed the singer only found out his cancer was terminal months before he died. David Bowie: Fans will gather to mark the anniversary of his death (Justin Tallis/AFP/Getty Images) 
A BBC documentary that aired on Saturday night revealed that Bowie learned his treatment was to be stopped as he was recording the music video for Lazarus. More about:
